page.title: 20Canterbury Supernatural
page.content: At Sudbury Tower (Pound lane), the {ghost}of Archbishop Simon Sudbury appears (beheaded in 1381). 'Querns' by St.Martin's windmill, ghost of an old man. Novelist Noel Streatfield told of hauntings in{Cathedral}precinct house of Canon Venn. 16, St.Dunstan's, a{poltergeist.} In 1705, the ghost of the deceased Mrs Veal appeared to her friend, Mrs Bargrove. Nell Cook, after poisoning her employer Canon Mortor and niece Elaine was burned alive under Cathedral Dark Entry. Her spirit haunts on Fridays. Black hooded monk in cloisters. Haunted Jesuit chapel, St. Stephens. Ghost and noises in old White Friars. 'The elms', Old Dover Rd,{hauntings.} Witches ducking stool at the Weavers.
